summary: This is a supplemental declaration filed by counsel to the Acting U.S. Attorney for the SDNY in support of the Federal Bureau of Prisons' motion for summary judgment in a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times. The declaration details the legal basis for withholding certain records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, citing FOIA Exemption 7(A) to prevent interference with the pending prosecutions of BOP employees (Noel) and inmate Tartaglione.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document concerns records related to his incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). His apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, and death are central to the withheld records.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: A BOP employee being prosecuted. The declaration argues that releasing certain prison records could interfere with the Noel prosecution by influencing witness testimony and jury selection.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: An inmate whose interactions with Epstein in July 2019 are relevant to his own criminal case. The declaration states that releasing details of Epstein's July 23 suicide attempt could interfere with the Tartaglione prosecution.

connections.description: Noel was a BOP employee at the MCC where Epstein was incarcerated. The prosecution of Noel is related to events surrounding Epstein's incarceration and death.
Tartaglione interacted with Epstein in July 2019. Details of these interactions and Epstein's suicide attempt are relevant to Tartaglione's own criminal case.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein had an apparent suicide attempt while incarcerated at the MCC. Psychological records and a lieutenant's log entry from this date are being withheld.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC. The document references media speculation and theories about his death.

events.title: Prior Declaration Filed
events.description: The declarant references their prior declaration submitted in the FOIA case, which detailed their service and the initial review of records.

events.title: Filing of Supplemental Declaration
events.description: This supplemental declaration is filed to further support BOP's motion for summary judgment in the FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times.

keyFacts: The Federal Bureau of Prisons is withholding records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death, citing FOIA Exemption 7(A) to prevent interference with ongoing prosecutions of BOP staff (Noel) and an inmate (Tartaglione).

Withheld records include inmate count documents, staffing rosters, psychological notes on Epstein, and BOP logs from August 9-10, 2019, which the government anticipates will be used as evidence or witness testimony in the Noel trial.

Details of Epstein's apparent suicide attempt on July 23, 2019, contained in psychological records and a lieutenant's log, are also being withheld as they may be relevant evidence in the Tartaglione case.

The declaration argues that premature release of these records could influence witness testimony, enable witnesses to shape their stories, and impair the ability to seat an impartial jury due to widespread media speculation about Epstein's death.
This document is part of a FOIA lawsuit (20-cv-00833) filed by The New York Times Company against the Federal Bureau of Prisons seeking records on Epstein's incarceration.
